response: "Why do I feel like I'm constantly under a microscope, judged for everything I do?"
"I'm so overwhelmed by this pressure to be perfect, I can't even remember who I am anymore."
"It's like society expects me to have it all figured out, but I'm just stumbling in the dark."
"I'm starting to question if anyone actually cares about who I am as a person, or if it's all just about appearances."
"I feel like I'm going insane trying to meet everyone's unrealistic expectations."
"I can't escape this constant voice in my head telling me I'm not good enough."
"I'm so tired of pretending to be someone I'm not, just to fit into society's narrow definition of perfection."
"It feels like everyone else has it all together, and I'm the only one struggling to keep up."
"I'm losing sight of what really matters because I'm so fixated on meeting society's impossible standards."
"I don't even know what's real anymore, everything feels distorted by this pressure to be flawless."
